person.persName: Silas Adams (Union Lt. Col, kentucky attorney.)

body.p: Born in Pulaski County, Ky., February 9, 1839. Moved to Casey County with his parents in 1841. Studied at Kentucky University at Harrodsburg, and Transylvania University at Lexington. In Union Army during the Civil War as a first lieutenant, First Regiment, Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry. Promoted to Captain, Lieutenant Colonel, and Colonel of the regiment. Mustered out December 31, 1864. Died in Liberty, Casey County, Ky., May 5, 1896.
